etymons.notes: ʕrǧ ‘lahm sein, lahmen, hinken, humpeln’ Wehr 826

Infectum.turoyo: gd-əṯyo emo d-aryo raġla qəṣto-yo ko-mhalxo ko-mʕaržo me-raġla
translations: Then a mother lion shall come, her foot is swollen. She limps on her foot (while) she walks

Infectum.turoyo: The pain receded. But he became lame we was limping with one of his legs Sultan_Nisane
